Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis:

• Frame 1: The vehicle directly ahead of the ego car appears to be a compact or midsize sedan. Its body color looks distinctly darker than the red car on the right but also shows strong bluish tones.  
• Frame 2: The same vehicle is immediately in front, and the color again appears like a dark or royal blue (definitely not black, red, or white).  
• Frame 3: No change in the vehicle’s position or color; lighting and angle remain consistent, confirming a blue hue.  
• Frame 4: The vehicle continues in front of the ego, still showing the same dark blue body.  
• Frame 5: The lighting is slightly dim, but the car’s color is still clearly a dark blue, not black or any other color.

Contextual Reasoning:  
Across all five frames, the vehicle in front retains a consistent dark blue tone and can easily be distinguished from other vehicles around it (the red hatchback to the right, for instance). There is no indication of the color shifting to black (which would appear less reflective of blue highlights in the available light) or any other option among the multiple choices.

Match to Answer Choices:  
• A (Black) – The car’s color is too clearly blue to be mistaken for black.  
• B (Blue) – Matches the observed color in each frame.  
• C (Red) – There's a red car visible off to the right, but not the one directly in front.  
• D (White) – Not supported by the frames; the car is clearly dark in color and specifically blue.

Provide the Best Answer:  
Based on the visual evidence in all frames, the car immediately in front of the ego vehicle is blue.

<answer>B</answer>
